snippet: Work had been stalled for nearly a year because of a longstanding dispute between Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg and Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo over costs and oversight.
abstract: Mayor Michael R Bloomberg and Gov Andrew M Cuomo reach an agreement to resume construction of the National September 11 Memorial and Museum; resolution follows nearly a year of discord and dispute over which government agencies would pay for the costs of the museum and which officials would oversee it; Gov Chris Christie of New Jersey also agrees to the arrangement.
lead_paragraph: Work had been stalled for nearly a year because of a longstanding dispute between Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg and Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo over costs and oversight.

headline.seo: Ground Zero Museum to Resume Construction as Cuomo and Bloomberg End Dispute
headline.main: Agreement Will Restart Work on Sept. 11 Museum
headline.print_headline: Bloomberg and Cuomo Announce Deal to Restart Construction of Museum at Ground Zero

keywords.value: Port Authority of New York and New Jersey
keywords.name: organizations
